title: [P3] Implement multiple disjoint SFC ranges for 3D sphere queries
description:
CONTEXT: Current estimateSFCRange() returns single [min,max] range, but 3D sphere projections onto Morton curve create multiple disjoint segments. This causes false negatives and inefficiency.

LOCATION: MortonKey.java lines 302-356 (estimateSFCRange method)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- Single contiguous range assumption is geometrically incorrect for 3D
- Morton curve winds through 3D space in complex patterns
- Sphere boundary crosses curve multiple times creating gaps
- Results in: (1) Missing nearby entities, (2) Scanning irrelevant regions

ALGORITHM:
1. Compute Morton codes for sphere's 8 corner points (AABB approximation)
2. For each octree level intersecting sphere, compute Morton range
3. Return List<Range> of disjoint SFC segments
4. Modify k-NN search to iterate multiple ranges efficiently

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Change estimateSFCRange() return type from Range to List<Range>
- Add computeMultipleRanges(center, radius, level) method
- Update bidirectionalSFCExpansion() to handle multiple ranges
- Use ConcurrentSkipListMap.subMap() for each range segment

TDD REQUIREMENTS:
- New test: MultipleSFCRangesTest validates range computation correctness
- Test case: Verify sphere at octree boundaries produces multiple ranges
- KNNSFCPruningBenchmark should show improved accuracy (fewer false negatives)
- All existing k-NN tests must pass
- Code must compile cleanly

EXPECTED IMPROVEMENT: 2-3× by reducing wasted scans in irrelevant regions

REVIEW REQUIREMENTS:
- Verify geometric correctness of range computation
- Check performance impact of multiple range iteration vs single range
- Code review by code-review-expert agent
- Plan audit by plan-auditor agent

DEPENDENCIES: Blocks on Luciferase-akx, Luciferase-zok, Luciferase-6kh (need all algorithmic fixes first)

title: Research-Driven Spatial Index Enhancements (Papers 1-5)
[P2] Replace O(n) findNodesIntersectingBounds with hierarchical descent
description:
CONTEXT: Deep-analyst identified O(n) linear scans in findNodesIntersectingBounds() as major bottleneck. This affects both Octree and Tetree implementations.

LOCATIONS:
- Octree.java lines 226-260 (findNodesIntersectingBounds)
- Tetree.java lines 1650-1694 (fast path) and 2188-2229 (SFC optimization)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- Iterates ALL nodes in spatial index checking AABB intersection
- O(n) complexity scales linearly with entity count
- At 100k entities, wastes CPU checking 99,000+ irrelevant nodes

ALGORITHM:
1. Start at root level of tree hierarchy
2. For each level, check if query bounds intersect node's spatial bounds
3. If no intersection: skip entire subtree (exponential pruning)
4. If intersection: recursively descend to children
5. At leaf level, collect intersecting entities
6. Target complexity: O(log n + k) where k = result set size

IMPLEMENTATION FOR OCTREE:
- Use Morton code properties for hierarchical descent
- Parent-child relationship: child codes are prefixes of parent
- Use ConcurrentSkipListMap.subMap() to get children range
- Decode Morton to AABB for intersection testing

IMPLEMENTATION FOR TETREE:
- Similar approach using TetreeKey hierarchy
- Use Tet.coordinates() for actual tetrahedral bounds (NOT cube approximation)
- Leverage tmIndex() for parent-child navigation

TDD REQUIREMENTS:
- New test: HierarchicalDescentTest validates correctness vs linear scan
- Performance test showing O(log n) behavior vs O(n)
- All existing collision/ray/frustum tests must pass (they use this method)
- Specific tests: OctreeCollisionTest, TetreeCollisionTest
- Code must compile cleanly

EXPECTED IMPROVEMENT: 5-20× speedup (reduces 100k scan to ~log2(100k) ≈ 17 levels)

REVIEW REQUIREMENTS:
- Verify hierarchical descent preserves correctness (no missed intersections)
- Check thread-safety with ConcurrentSkipListMap
- Code review by code-review-expert agent
- Plan audit by plan-auditor agent

DEPENDENCIES: Blocks on Luciferase-akx, Luciferase-zok (need optimized k-NN first for accurate benchmarking)

title: [P3] Cache decoded Morton coordinates in hot path
description:
CONTEXT: Profiling shows Morton.decode() called repeatedly in tight loops during k-NN search. Each decode involves bit manipulation operations.

LOCATION: MortonKey.java, AbstractSpatialIndex.java (k-NN methods)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- decodeMorton() called for every candidate during distance calculation
- Same Morton code decoded multiple times
- Bit manipulation overhead in tight loop

ALGORITHM:
1. Add transient Point3f decodedCoords field to MortonKey
2. Lazy initialization on first decode() call
3. Cache invalidation not needed (keys are immutable)
4. Memory trade-off: 12 bytes per key vs repeated computation

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Modify MortonKey.decode() to cache result
- Add @JsonIgnore to prevent serialization of cached coords
- Benchmark memory overhead vs performance gain

TDD REQUIREMENTS:
- Existing MortonKeyTest must pass (verify caching doesn't break correctness)
- KNNSFCPruningBenchmark should show reduced decode time
- Memory profiler check: ensure no memory leak from cached coords
- Code must compile cleanly

EXPECTED IMPROVEMENT: 2-3× speedup in distance calculation hot path

REVIEW REQUIREMENTS:
- Verify thread-safety (immutable keys = safe)
- Check serialization/deserialization still works
- Code review by code-review-expert agent

# Epic: Web-based Spatial Inspector Migration

Migrate spatial visualization from JavaFX to web-based architecture (Javalin + Three.js).
This is a greenfield migration - JavaFX will be completely removed.

## Rationale
- JavaFX apps have launch issues from automated processes
- Web UI enables fully automated testing of backend logic
- Better separation of concerns: backend testable independently
- More portable across platforms
- Modern 3D visualization via Three.js/WebGL

1. **Backend**: Javalin 6.3.0 web server with REST API
2. **Frontend**: Three.js for WebGL 3D visualization
3. **Session Management**: ConcurrentHashMap for multi-user support

5. **Testing**: 100% backend testability without JavaFX

title: [P1] Implement bidirectional SFC expansion for k-NN search
description:
CONTEXT: Paper 4 'Space-Filling Curve Based Point Clouds Index' describes optimal k-NN using bidirectional expansion from query point along SFC. Current implementation uses flawed estimateSFCRange() assuming contiguous ranges.

LOCATION: AbstractSpatialIndex.java lines 1450-1600 (performKNNSFCRangePruning)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- estimateSFCRange() returns single [min,max] range
- 3D sphere projections create multiple disjoint SFC segments
- Results in false negatives (missing nearby entities)

ALGORITHM FROM PAPER 4:
1. Encode query point to Morton code
2. Binary search to find query point position in sorted keys
3. Expand bidirectionally (forward/backward) along SFC
4. Collect k nearest candidates
5. Use Euclidean distance as tiebreaker

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Add bidirectionalSFCExpansion(queryPoint, k, maxDistance) method
- Use ConcurrentSkipListMap.headMap()/tailMap() for efficient range iteration
- Track k-best candidates in priority queue ordered by distance
- Stop when SFC distance exceeds current k-th best distance

TDD REQUIREMENTS:
- Existing KNNSFCPruningBenchmark must show improvement at 100k entities
- All existing k-NN tests must pass (OctreeKNNTest, TetreeKNNTest)
- New test: BidirectionalSFCExpansionTest validating algorithm correctness
- Code must compile cleanly before marking complete

EXPECTED IMPROVEMENT: 50-100× speedup at 100k entities (4.8ms → 0.05-0.10ms)

REVIEW REQUIREMENTS:
- Code review by code-review-expert agent
- Plan audit by plan-auditor agent
- Verify Paper 4 algorithm implementation matches specification

title: [BLOCKER] Redesign Hierarchical Descent or Use Spatial Hashing
description: CRITICAL BLOCKER: Plan-auditor found bead Luciferase-6kh architecturally impossible. Claims to use parent-child tree descent but ConcurrentSkipListMap stores only leaf nodes with entities, not hierarchical structure. ARCHITECTURAL ANALYSIS: Current storage is sparse skip-list with only populated leaf nodes. No parent nodes stored, no children array exists, cannot descend from root to children. EVIDENCE: Octree.java:226-260 shows O(n) iteration over keySet(), Tetree.java:1651 intentionally uses linear scan for small datasets. ALTERNATIVES: (1) Spatial Hashing Grid: 64x64x64 cells, O(1) lookup for bounds queries, (2) Multi-level SFC ranges: Compute disjoint ranges per level, (3) Keep O(n) for small datasets, optimize only large scale. RECOMMENDATION: Replace hierarchical descent with spatial hashing. Expected complexity: O(k) where k is entities in intersecting cells. BLOCKS: Luciferase-6kh must be redesigned before implementation

title: [P1] Add SFC distance-based early termination
description:
CONTEXT: Once we have bidirectional SFC expansion, we need early termination to avoid scanning entire dataset. SFC distance provides upper bound on Euclidean distance.

LOCATION: AbstractSpatialIndex.java (new method in bidirectional expansion)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- No early termination in SFC traversal
- Scans continue even when remaining candidates cannot possibly be closer
- Wastes CPU on provably non-optimal regions

ALGORITHM:
1. During bidirectional expansion, track k-th best Euclidean distance
2. For each candidate SFC key, compute SFC distance from query point
3. If SFC distance > k-th best Euclidean distance, terminate expansion in that direction
4. SFC distance formula: |mortonCode1 - mortonCode2| provides upper bound
5. Continue expansion in other direction if still viable

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Add computeSFCDistance(Key k1, Key k2) method to SpatialKey interface
- Implement for MortonKey (simple subtraction) and TetreeKey (consecutive index delta)
- Add early termination logic in bidirectionalSFCExpansion()
- Track forward/backward expansion independently

TDD REQUIREMENTS:
- New test: SFCEarlyTerminationTest validates termination correctness
- Verify termination doesn't cause false negatives (missing actual k-nearest)
- KNNSFCPruningBenchmark should show reduced candidate evaluations
- All existing k-NN tests must pass
- Code must compile cleanly

EXPECTED IMPROVEMENT: Additional 2-3× on top of P1 (combined 100-300× at 100k entities)

REVIEW REQUIREMENTS:
- Verify SFC distance calculation is mathematically sound
- Ensure early termination preserves correctness (no false negatives)
- Code review by code-review-expert agent

DEPENDENCIES: Blocks on Luciferase-akx (bidirectional SFC expansion)
